usr_func package¶

Submodules¶

usr_func.EIBV module¶

This function contains two different implementations for EIBV calculation.

usr_func.EIBV.EIBV_approximate(threshold, mu, Sig, H, R)¶

threshold: float number for characterizing the threshold between fresh water and saline water. mu: mean vector Sig: Covariance matrix H: sampling vector R: nugget or measurement noise matrix

usr_func.EIBV.EIBV_mvn(threshold, mu, Sig, H, R)¶

threshold: float number for characterizing the threshold between fresh water and saline water. mu: mean vector Sig: Covariance matrix H: sampling vector R: nugget or measurement noise matrix

usr_func.EIBV.calc_eibv()¶

usr_func.checkfolder module¶

Checks if the folder exists or not.

usr_func.checkfolder.checkfolder(folder)¶

usr_func.get_resume_state module¶

This function will get the global resume state

usr_func.get_resume_state.get_resume_state() → bool¶

usr_func.interpolate_2d module¶

Interpolates values in 2d grid discretization.

usr_func.interpolate_2d.interpolate_2d(x, y, nx, ny, value, interpolation_method='linear')¶

Use griddata to interpolate to a finer results

usr_func.interpolate_3d module¶

This function interpolates 3d values.

usr_func.interpolate_3d.interpolate_3d(x: numpy.ndarray, y: numpy.ndarray, z: numpy.ndarray, value: numpy.ndarray) → tuple¶

Interpolates values for 3d grid by interpolate on 2d layers and combine them together

usr_func.is_even module¶

This function tests if a given integer is even or not.

usr_func.is_even.is_even(value: int) → bool¶

Checks if a given integer even or not.

Parameters:

value – integer value

Returns: True if it is even, False or else.

usr_func.is_list_empty module¶

This function tests if a given list is empty or not.

usr_func.is_list_empty.is_list_empty(glist)¶

Tests if a given list is empty or not.

Parameters:

glist – can be nested list such as [], [[]], [[[]]] etc.

Returns: True if it is empty, such as [], [[]], [[[]]], etc.

usr_func.normalize module¶

usr_func.normalize.normalize(x, amin=0, amax=1)¶

usr_func.refill_nan_values module¶

Refills nan values with neighbouring values.

usr_func.refill_nan_values.refill_nan_values(data: numpy.ndarray) → numpy.ndarray¶

usr_func.set_resume_state module¶

This function will set the global resume state

usr_func.set_resume_state.set_resume_state(state: bool = False) → None¶

usr_func.sort_polygon_vertices module¶

This function sorts the polygon with the counter-clockwise direction.

usr_func.sort_polygon_vertices.sort_polygon_vertices(polygon: numpy.ndarray) → numpy.ndarray¶

Sort the polygon counter-clockwisely.

Args: vertices of the polygon is not organised in order.
polygon: np.array([[x1, y1, z1],

[x2, y2, z2], … [xn, yn, zn]])

Returns: sorted polygon with the direction of counter-clockwise.

usr_func.vectorize module¶

Vectorize the input array.

usr_func.vectorize.vectorize(array: numpy.ndarray) → numpy.ndarray¶

Vectorize the input array according to column first ordering. :param array: (n, m) dimension array.

Returns:

(n*m, 1) dimension vector.

Return type:

vector
